boat.name: Master Frank
boat.full_description:
Master Frank was built between 1893 and 1895 and according to a report in the Ramsey Courieur at her launch, 29 January 1896: 'She is very strongly built and bids fair to be a good, useful boat.' She was a  half-deck longliner, used to fish for cod, named after the fishing method of using a long line.

She was built for Mr Frank Shakley of Whitehaven, but was only at Whitehaven for 3 months before coming back to Ramsey and the ownership of the Kinnin Family. They owned her until 1969.

After that she has a number of owners before coming into the possession of Joe Pennington in 1993. He rebuilt her as originally as possible.
boat.construction_details: Using traditional methods, fully rebuilt by current owner
boat.short_description: Master Frank, launched in 1896, continued to fish commercially until 1978 and, following an extensive restoration project by her current owner, is still seen sailing off the Isle of Man coast.
